intro: Eryngium lingua-tucani, commonly known as the "tongue of the devil," is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its spiky, blue or purple flower heads. The plant has narrow, gray-green leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a hardy addition to gardens. Its unique appearance and ecological importance make it a notable species in its native habitat.
